module_restrictions: Exchange students can choose CCs in the Core Programme and/or elective major specialties provided that the courses taken are effectively taught (and taken) during the appropriate semester and that the choice is compatible with the overall university course schedules.
visa_info: Long-Stay visas are necessary for stays exceeding 3 months. Upon arrival in France, students are required to register with the French Immigration and Integration Office (OFII) for a residence permit. All students who wish to study in France must follow the Campus France procedure on Etudes en France online platform before applying for a visa.

accommodations_info.university_accommodation: There are two types of accommodation available: student residences managed by the French government (CROUS) and private residences. Student residences are generally situated at a walking distance from the campus facilities and academic departments. Students who wish to stay in the student residence must contact the international office by sending an email to sadia.baiche@utc.fr.

university_description: Université de Technologie Compiègne (UTC) is located in Compiègne, northern France, and is a leading engineering school. It offers a flexible course system whereby the students gain and accumulate Credit Course (CCs) points, over a two-semester period.
location_cost_of_living: Compiègne is an affordable place to live. The city is small, and the cost of living is generally lower when compared to Paris or other large French cities.
location_description: Compiègne is a charming city rich in history and culture. It is known for its beautiful forest and the Château de Compiègne, the former summer residence of French kings.
location_transportation: Public transportation options in Compiègne include buses and trains. The city has a train station with regular connections to Paris and other major cities in France.
